materials.raw_text: Barium (B) - 12 g, Praseodymium (Pr) - 3 g, Samarium (Sm) - 1 g, Technetium (Tc) - 6 g

sourcing.instructions: Barium: Chemical supply stores or online chemical suppliers; Praseodymium: Rare earth element suppliers; Samarium: Rare earth element suppliers; Technetium: Specialized radioactive material suppliers (ensure proper handling and licensing)
steps: Barium: Chemical supply stores or online chemical suppliers; Praseodymium: Rare earth element suppliers; Samarium: Rare earth element suppliers; Technetium: Specialized radioactive material suppliers (ensure proper handling and licensing)

1. Wear appropriate safety gear (gloves, goggles, lab coat). 2. Weigh each ingredient precisely using a digital scale. 3. Combine Barium, Praseodymium, and Samarium in a clean, dry mixing container. 4. Stir thoroughly until a uniform powder is achieved. 5. Slowly add Technetium while continuously stirring to ensure even distribution.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Wear appropriate safety gear (gloves, goggles, lab coat). 2. Weigh each ingredient precisely using a digital scale. 3. Combine Barium, Praseodymium, and Samarium in a clean, dry mixing container. 4. Stir thoroughly until a uniform powder is achieved. 5. Slowly add Technetium while continuously stirring to ensure even distribution.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 1-2 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace door until it is completely cooled to prevent thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 1-2 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace door until it is completely cooled to prevent thermal shock.

steps: 1. Remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Allow the sample to rest for 24 hours at room temperature. 3. Use fine-grit sandpaper to smooth any rough edges. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to protect the surface if required. 5. Label the sample with composition and date for future reference.
